Articles.Content:
So I’m not necessarily asking for a release date, but considering the past console port, lack of support and transparency, I have to ask: Will it be days, weeks, months or years before we finally get a fully working product? I love you guys and I think I can speak for most of us console players when I say that you guys sincerely broke our hearts and threw it in a blender when you gave us that first tease of a port and then left it for dead. I absolutely adore KSP and it’s torture not knowing when I can play the game without worrying if it’s all going to be for nothing. With all that being said, when can the hype train for the big patch leave the station? 

Edited January 30, 2018 by Homedawgian

Considering how long the game has been tested and that these bugs are easy to find out, Im really afraid they were known bugs. And if fixing them would take 1 month, they would just pospone the release date to february.

So Im little bit afraid, that fixing these bugs is not so easy. (the estimation to fix them is so long, that they rather released the game as it is). So it may take a while before the patch is out.

This isn't necessarily true. As a Software Engineer, I wouldn't be surprised AT ALL if they were aware of at least some of these bugs, but had a release date to meet. KSP Enhanced took so long to release, I bet what happened was that Squad/Take-Two Upper Management Set a date and forced the devs to meet it. I guarantee you they (the devs) weren't happy about that and knew that it wasn't ready to be released yet. But because it had already been delayed over and over,  Management said something to the effect of "OK. When is the soonest we can release this, even with bugs?" So the devs squashed the high priority bugs and had no choice but to leave the rest.
